attributes.action: I would like you to deem cyclical Vomiting Syndrome a disability to aid research
attributes.background: I would like the government to look at the condition and deem it a disability so that people who suffer this condition and there families could claim benefits easier and so that the condition is researched so that there can be cure found.

rejection.details:
The Government's guidance on disability under the Equality Act 2010 states that you’re disabled if you have a physical or mental impairment that has a ‘substantial’ and ‘long-term’ negative effect on your ability to do normal daily activities:
https://www.gov.uk/definition-of-disability-under-equality-act-2010

There is not a list of conditions that meet this definition, but it is therefore already the case that under the Equality Act, anyone with a physical or a mental condition which has a substantial and long-term impact on your ability to do normal day to day activities is protected under the disability protected characteristic. This could cover people who have vomiting syndrome, where this has a a ‘substantial’ and ‘long-term’ negative effect on their ability to do normal daily activities.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to provide additional funding for research into vomiting syndrome, if that's something you'd like to happen.
